name: Holbox Hotel Mawimbi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we have been staying for two weeks at mawimbi and it is a fact that it is a very relaxing hotel , nice people , very calm , and very clean ! the island of holbox is , like many say , very small but not so very clean , in front of the hotels the beaches are well kept but once outside those places and in town , it can be very dirty . people leave their trash every where , like in africa we would say , but here it is a pitty because it is an island . My purpose for my visit was a vacation with my wife , without the children for once , and to kite . Unfortunately i could kite only once , wind was not enough , and the day it was possible it was a tropical storm , wind from the nortwest 27 knots , but this can happen everywhere in the world , so i don't mind . The food is very nice , in the hotel as in town , we had every night a different restaurant for 10days , so enough of those . Restaurants like zarabande , own by locals , is very good for its fish soup and many other plates , adelin for it's pizza's and lobster ( although service is very slow ) , and many more . If interested in prices , don't worry : we had once breakfast for 4 euro for two persons , and evening dinner with bottle of wine costs us always between 20 and 25 euros for the two of us . Life is very cheap around here . Try to change your dollars or euro's in the hotels , and pay in pesos , it is much more easier for everyone and you are sure about the value . One more thing : beware of mosquitos and sand fleas especially in the evening and sure when wind is coming from the south , the can be very nasty , it is a fact that when wind is coming from northern directions there is not a problem and this is most of the time the direction it blows here . We had some rain here , not much , and then you must hide for those creatures !! i was full of them , and sand fleas can jump high , very high !! but no worry , bring some baby oil against the sand fleas ( that's what they learned us here ) and have a nice stay
reviews.title: our two weeks stay at mawimbi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I (late 20s/early 30s) just got back from 4 nights at Mawimbi. I absolutely loved it. The location was perfect - right on the beach, with well kept loung chairs & hammocks. There was a cute little bar that offered breakfast & afternoon snacks, and seemed to be open (for alcohol) most nights. It was very very quiet, the only thing you could hear at night were the waves crashing on the shore. it was beautiful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Beach Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The property was extremely clean. Every morning employees were sifting through the sand, making sure that there weren't any sharp shells to catch on your bare feet. They took great care of their "home", while we were there they were constantly fixing it up, making sure it was in top notch shape. Their hard work shines through, everything was perfect.
reviews.title: Very relaxing and peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are on a tight budget, so got the smallest room, but with a balcony. The room had a nice sized bed (uncomfortable mattress though), 2 shelves & a night stand. The bathroom was spacious with a big shower & adorable beach details. The balcony had a table for 2 and 2 hammocks - it was perfect.
reviews.title: Stay at Hotel Mawimbi, wonderful place on the island!

likes.liked: — You literally walk out the door and step onto the beach. 10 yards to shoreline!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was cleaned daily with new towels & we got fresh sheets our 3rd night. I was nervous about bugs (in Holbox in general), and I am very pleased to announce we did not have a single mosquito in our room. We did have tiny ants on our nightstand & on the shelves, but they were harmless & we didn't really mind.
reviews.title: What a find !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location, wonderful hotelito and very kindly guys.
reviews.title: A Paradise

likes.disliked: — Can't use credit card on island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: You can read positive review posted before and i want just agree. Just a thing. You can read everywhere about mosquito on the isle. I've benn there in august and i never use repellent. It's impossible go to holbox and do not swim with with whale sharks. I can recommend you the hotel staff. Alex and nati are great guide and awasome guys
reviews.title: One of the best all around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So beatiful, peaceful and the people are GREAT!. Good drinks at the bar. Bar closes early which can be nice b/c it keeps it quiet in the evening. A/C worked well in the room. Naps in the hammocks are Divine. Arrange your Whale Shark tour through them and you get Alex, the best quide.
reviews.title: Ready to go Back! Amazing and so Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise this little resort and island were to us. We have been going to Mexico for over 14 years and Isla Holbox is a true gem. The hotel is so charming. Clean, comfortable, right on the beach and the staff are wonderful. The pictures on the website do not do it justice.
reviews.title: wonderful getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Alex and Naty with the whale shark tour were great. Very professional and easy going.
reviews.title: Friendly place

likes.disliked: — I love the topless woman, but with little children around they should go to a more secluded area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: No need to say more, this is the place to be in Holbox!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful beach, wonderful spot, and nice pasta in town.
reviews.title: nice place, beautiful beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just relax
reviews.title: Mawimbi a must!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Mawimbi for 5 days. The place was great, with a great beach area, good food and nice rooms. I am not a demanding vacationer, but my only issue was that the staff were not that great. We stayed for a night at Las Tortugas which is right next door, and the rooms are similar, the beach just as nice, and the staff are much nicer. Holbox island is absolutely great. Very laid back, beautiful beaches, great natural preserve.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Mawimbi in January to celebrate our birthdays. It was a wonderful trip. We spent 8 days doing just what we wanted to do - sunbathe, walk on the beach, relax in a hammock, read, walk into town, ride in a golf cart, go on a river trip, drink cervezas, etc. Holbox and Mawimbi were just what we wanted and what we expected from TripAdvisors comments.
reviews.title: Choose Mawimbi!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mawimbi was a beautiful, quiet locale with a very intimate, rustic vibe. Overall our experience had little issue, but there are a few notes worth pointing out (to keep it honest). As others have mentioned, the stretch of beach is small, but fantastic with white sands, infinite shells, and gorgeous Mayan sunsets. This setting can truly compete with some of the best beaches I believe. On one occassion we sat in our beach chairs watching the dolphins swim just off shore...AMAZING! The accomodations are simple, but have great character. You truly feel removed from the "hustle-and-bustle" of a generic resort. Great excursions, through Mawimbi, and guides.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Unfortunatley I need to mention a couple of key points. I was surprised that few, if any, previous reviews mentioned the bugs. They were a huge issue with all the resort's guests during our stay. Ensure to purchase bug spray and use it frequently. Mosquitos and sand fleas are all over throughout the entire day...be warned!
reviews.title: ... did we mention the beach?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Also there were some issues with cleaning and privacy. The beach and grounds were sometimes unkept (beer bottles, plates, etc.). This happened often even upon our arrival when escorted to our room. The host passed a huge mess left by our neighbors that they ignored and wasn't cleaned until the afternoon the next day.
reviews.title: For a hideaway the Hotel Mawimbi is a dream come true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned privacy was an issue, specifically being honeymooners. When we were first taken to our room we noticed that the ocean front patio is shared with the room next door (the OF's appear to be the only rooms set up as such). Naturally this offers little privacy and neighbors and resort can crowd this shared Ocean front patio area (even the area designated to us). At one point performing massages to other guests directly in front of our room. we couldn't even open our door all the way and it cramped our beautiful view we paid for. This was an obvious disruption that was ignored.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When bringing up issue, we didn't necessarily experience the warm welcome from the staff as received by others. We wouldn't have had issue with this, but felt that we weren't accomodated equally. Overall the staff seemed hit-and-miss and we are not fussy at all. We are truly easy goin'...trust me. There were particular items the resort staff and owners should have handled more properly because it was clearly inappropriate. They seemed to just look the other way and if we asked we felt like a bother. We would definately return, but with a more open mind (and alot of bug spray).
reviews.title: Peaceful and simple in a friendly atmosphere

description: Mawimbi is a small-charming and tropical Hotel located on the beach of Holbox Island, where you will find an unforgettable atmosphere and you can spend very special moments relaxing on the big beach.This palm shaded beach front oasis lies just beyond the outskirts of Holbox town. Mawimbi has been created paying particular attention to details and showing due respect to Nature’s Harmony of colors and shapes. It has been carefully built and decorated using products and techniques of the ancient Mayan culture. The curtains, bedclothes and pillows are made of antique Guatemalan ponchos, while the bathrooms are decorated with colored Mexican ceramics. Likewise, the tables and chairs have been carved and crafted from local trunks, as well as the entire hotel building, the bar and beach area.All of it surrounded by a luxuriant tropical garden.
